metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12934 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12934` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-common - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-for-build - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-for-host - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-multiarch - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-source - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
libbinutils - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
libctf0 - 2.33-2ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> issue is actually in libiberty

criterions.comment: binutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33-2ubuntu1.2').
